column1: Dyshidrotic eczema is a condition in which small blisters develop on the hands and feet.
Eczema (atopic dermatitis) is a long-term (chronic) skin disorder that involves scaly and itchy rashes.

You are more likely to develop dyshidrotic eczema when: - You are under stress - You have allergies, such as hay fever - Your hands are often in water or moist - You work with cement or do other work that exposes your hands to chromium, cobalt, or nickel
Small fluid-filled blisters called vesicles appear on the fingers, hands, and feet.
